ai-mil6.2.7:1.1_0: “Reverend Sir, there is a native spirit in the world who are not pleased.”
ai-mil6.2.7:1.2_0: “I do, great king, there are no demons in the world.”
ai-mil6.2.7:1.3_0: “But sir, are you giving away from that spirit?”
ai-mil6.2.7:1.4_0: “Yes, great king, I believe that yakkha.”
ai-mil6.2.7:1.5_0: “Sir, why do you say that when the spirits are dead don’t come?”
ai-mil6.2.7:1.6_0: “Great king, will see a corpse disclose from any sort of spirits or clay balls or girls, when the body is dead or ashes, and their colours will burn with scent, ointments, consequence, or two colours for fun, boxes, or even if they’ll give nostrils.”
ai-mil6.2.7:1.7_0: “Sir, who is asked another question: ‘Who would answer it when asked?”
ai-mil6.2.7:2.1_0: the seventh Question of the yakkha
